sen.j: 采女（うねめ）とは、日本の朝廷において天皇や皇后に近侍し、食事など身の回りの雑事を専門に行う女官のこと。
sen.e: Uneme were maids-in-waiting who attended to the emperor or empress in the Imperial Court to exclusively take care of the emperor or empress including meals.
Uneme was a maid-in-waiting who attended to the emperor or empress in the Imperial Court to exclusively take care of the emperor or empress including meals.
Uneme was a maid-in-waiting who attended to the emperor or empress in the Imperial Court to exclusively take care of the emperor or empress including meals.

sen.j: 平安時代以降は廃れ、特別な行事の時のみの役職となった。
sen.e: From the Heian period, Uneme became obsolete to be the post only required for special events.
From the Heian period, Uneme became obsolete so as to be the post only required in special events.
sen.cmt: to be the post --> so as to be the post, required for --> required in
sen.e: From the Heian period, Uneme became obsolete so as to be the post only required in special events.

sen.j: 概略
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 発祥ははっきりしないが、『日本書紀』によると既に飛鳥時代には地方の豪族がその娘を天皇家に献上する習慣があった。
sen.e: Although the origin of Uneme is unknown, "Nihonshoki" describes that it was a custom of powerful regional clans to present their daughters to the Imperial family as early as the Asuka period.

Although the origin of Uneme is unknown, "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) describes that it was a custom of powerful regional clans to present their daughters to the Imperial family as early as the Asuka period.

Although the origin of Uneme is unknown, "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) describes that it was a custom of powerful regional clans to present their daughters to the Imperial family as early as the Asuka period.

sen.j: 一種の人質であり、豪族が服属したことを示したものと考える説が有力だが、延喜17年（917年）の太政官符に、出雲国造が「神宮采女」と称して妾を蓄えることを禁止しつつも神道祭祀に必要な場合には1名に限り認める内容のものがあることを根拠に、地方の祭祀を天皇家が吸収統合していく過程で成立した制度で、祭祀においては妾と同一視され後述のとおり子供が出来る行為を伴ったと推測した説もある。
sen.e: While the most likely opinion has it that powerful regional clans offered their daughters as a king of hostage to show their subjugation to the emperor, there is another opinion based on the official document from Daijokan in 917, which forbade Izumo no Kuninomiyatsuko to keep mistress under the pretext of 'Jingu Uneme' except for one Uneme for shinto religious services as required, that Uneme was supposedly a system established in the process of the Imperial family's integration of regional religious services, and that Uneme was identified with mistress in the religious services, which involved the conduct to make Uneme pregnant as mentioned later.

While the most likely opinion has it that powerful regional clans offered their daughters as a kind of hostage to show their subjugation to the emperor, there is another opinion based on the official document from Daijokan in 917, which forbade Izumo no Kuninomiyatsuko to have a mistress under the pretext of 'Jingu Uneme' except for one Uneme for shinto religious services as required, that Uneme was supposedly a system established in the process of integration of regional religious services by the Imperial family, and that Uneme was identified with the mistress in the religious service, implying the conduct of making Uneme pregnant as mentioned later.
sen.cmt: king を kindに, keep mistress を have a mistressに変更、その他表現の見直し。
sen.e: While the most likely opinion has it that powerful regional clans offered their daughters as a kind of hostage to show their subjugation to the emperor, there is another opinion based on the official document from Daijokan in 917, which forbade Izumo no Kuninomiyatsuko to have a mistress under the pretext of 'Jingu Uneme' except for one Uneme for shinto religious services as required, that Uneme was supposedly a system established in the process of integration of regional religious services by the Imperial family, and that Uneme was identified with the mistress in the religious service, implying the conduct of making Uneme pregnant as mentioned later.

sen.j: 中には天皇の気に入り、その子供を産む者もいた。
sen.e: Some Uneme gained the emperor's favor and gave birth to the emperor's baby.
Some Uneme gained emperor's favor and gave birth to the emperor's baby.
Some Uneme gained emperor's favor and gave birth to the emperor's baby.

sen.j: が、当時は母親の身分も重視する時代であったため、采女出生の子供は中央豪族や皇族出生の子供に比べて低い立場に置かれることがほとんどであった。
sen.e: As the status of mother was also considered important in those days, the children born from Uneme were mostly placed lower than the children of the powerful clans in the capital or the Imperial family.

As the status of mother was also considered important in those days, the children born from Uneme were mostly placed lower than the children of the powerful clans in the capital or the Imperial family.

As the status of mother was also considered important in those days, the children born from Uneme were mostly placed lower than the children of the powerful clans in the capital or the Imperial family.

sen.j: 大宝律令の後宮職員令によって制度化される。
sen.e: Uneme became a system by Kokyu Shokuin Rei in Taiho ritsuryo legal code.
Uneme became a system by Kokyu Shokuin Rei in Taiho ritsuryo legal code.
Uneme became a system by Kokyu Shokuin Rei in Taiho ritsuryo legal code.

sen.j: その内容は以下の通りである。
sen.e: It is written as below.
It was written as below.
It was written as below.

sen.j: 中務省が発する牒により、諸国に定員を割り振って募集されるが、名目は「献上」という形を取った。
sen.e: Although Uneme was invited by a prescribed number for each province by the official document issued by Nakatsukasasho, Uneme were 'offered' formally.
Although Uneme were recruited from each province by a prescribed number indicated in the official document issued by Nakatsukasasho, Uneme were 'offered' formally.
Although Uneme were recruited from each province by a prescribed number indicated in the official document issued by Nakatsukasasho, Uneme were 'offered' formally.

sen.j: 募集条件は
sen.e: Requirements for Uneme were:
Requirement information for Uneme was:
Requirement information for Uneme was:

sen.j: 13歳以上30歳以下であること。
sen.e: at the age from 13 to 30;
at the age of 13 to 30;
at the age of 13 to 30;

sen.j: 出身は郡司以上の姉妹か娘であること。
sen.e: should be a sister or daughter of those at the status of Gunji or above; and
should be a sister or daughter of those at the status of Gunji or above; and
should be a sister or daughter of those at the status of Gunji or above; and

sen.j: 容姿を厳選すること。
sen.e: should be selected carefully by their figures.
should be selected carefully by their figures.
should be selected carefully by their figures.

sen.j: 宮内省の配下にある「采女司」に所属し、更に宮内庁配下の別の課に当たる「水司」に6名、「膳司（かしわでのつかさ）」に60名配属される。
sen.e: Uneme belonged to 'Uneme no Tsukasa' under Kunaisho and 6 Uneme were allocated to 'Suishi', which was another branch of Kunaisho, and 60 Uneme were allocated to 'Kashiwade no Tsukasa', which was another branch of Kunaisho.

Uneme belonged to 'Uneme no Tsukasa' under Kunaisho and 6 Uneme were allocated to 'Suishi', which was another branch of Kunaisho, and 60 Uneme were allocated to 'Kashiwade no Tsukasa', which was also another branch of Kunaisho.

Uneme belonged to 'Uneme no Tsukasa' under Kunaisho and 6 Uneme were allocated to 'Suishi', which was another branch of Kunaisho, and 60 Uneme were allocated to 'Kashiwade no Tsukasa', which was also another branch of Kunaisho.

sen.j: 定員は計66名であるが、同様の職種の女孺（定員152名）と皇子女付きの采女等も含むと見られている。
sen.e: The prescribed number was 66, but it is considered that the number included Nyoju (prescribed number was 152), which was similar to Uneme, and Uneme to the princess.
The prescribed number was 66, but it is considered that the number included Nyoju (prescribed number was 152), which was similar to Uneme, and Uneme to the princess.
The prescribed number was 66, but it is considered that the number included Nyoju (prescribed number was 152), which was similar to Uneme, and Uneme to the princess.

sen.j: 大宝律令の軍防令によると全国の郡の三分の一から采女を募集することとなっている。
sen.e: According to Gunborei of Taiho ritsuryo legal code, Uneme was to be raised from one third of counties across the country.
According to Gunborei of Taiho ritsuryo legal code, Uneme was to be raised from one third of counties across the country.
According to Gunborei of Taiho ritsuryo legal code, Uneme was to be raised from one third of counties across the country.

sen.j: 平城天皇の改革により、采女献上の制度は廃止され、「采女司」も廃止になり、残っていた采女は「縫殿寮」に所属した。
sen.e: According to the reform by Emperor Heizei, the system of offering Uneme was abolished and accordingly 'Uneme no Tsukasa' was abolished, and the remained Uneme became belonged to 'Nuidonoryo.'
According to the reform by Emperor Heizei, the system of offering Uneme was abolished and accordingly 'Uneme no Tsukasa' was abolished, and the remaining Uneme became to belong to 'Nuidonoryo.'
sen.cmt: the remained Uneme became belonged to --> the remaining Uneme became to belong to
sen.e: According to the reform by Emperor Heizei, the system of offering Uneme was abolished and accordingly 'Uneme no Tsukasa' was abolished, and the remaining Uneme became to belong to 'Nuidonoryo.'

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇は「采女司」を復活させたが、以後は采女は中央貴族の子女から選ばれるようになり、形骸化。
sen.e: Emperor Saga restored 'Uneme no Tsukasa', but thereafter, Uneme were selected from the daughters of the nobles in the capital and became a mere formality.
Emperor Saga restored 'Uneme no Tsukasa', but thereafter, Uneme were selected from the daughters of the nobles in the capital and became a mere formality.
Emperor Saga restored 'Uneme no Tsukasa', but thereafter, Uneme were selected from the daughters of the nobles in the capital and became a mere formality.

sen.j: 江戸時代以降は天皇の即位の礼の時のみ女官から選抜されるようになった。
sen.e: After the Edo period, Uneme were selected from court ladies only at the occasion of the emperor's enthronement ceremony.
From the Edo period, Uneme were selected from court ladies only on the occasion of an emperor's enthronement ceremony.
From the Edo period, Uneme were selected from court ladies only on the occasion of an emperor's enthronement ceremony.

sen.j: この時には、女官の正装たる十二単ではなく丈の短い特殊な采女装束を着用した。
sen.e: On this occasion, Uneme were dressed not in full uniform for court lady, Junihitoe, but special in a costume for Uneme which was shorter than Junihitoe.
On this occasion, Uneme were dressed not in full uniform of court lady, Junihitoe, but in a special costume for Uneme which was shorter than Junihitoe.
sen.cmt: full uniform for court lady --> full uniform of court lady, special in a costume for --> in a special costume for
sen.e: On this occasion, Uneme were dressed not in full uniform of court lady, Junihitoe, but in a special costume for Uneme which was shorter than Junihitoe.

sen.j: 歴史上有名な采女
sen.e: Historically well-known Uneme
Historically well-known Uneme
Historically well-known Uneme

sen.j: 伊賀宅子娘
sen.e: IGA no Yakakonoiratsume
IGA no Yakakonoiratsume
IGA no Yakakonoiratsume

sen.j: 伊賀国豪族・伊賀氏出身で天智天皇の長男・弘文天皇を産む。
sen.e: She was from the Iga clan, which was the powerful clan in Iga Province, and gave birth to Emperor Kobun, the first son of Emperor Tenji.
She was from the Iga clan, which was the powerful clan in Iga Province, and gave birth to Emperor Kobun, the first son of Emperor Tenji.
She was from the Iga clan, which was the powerful clan in Iga Province, and gave birth to Emperor Kobun, the first son of Emperor Tenji.

sen.j: 因幡八上采女
sen.e: INABANOYAKAMI no Uneme
INABANOYAKAMI no Uneme
INABANOYAKAMI no Uneme

sen.j: 因幡国八上郡の豪族・因幡国造氏出身で、『万葉集』に載せられた安貴王との悲恋で知られる。
sen.e: She was from the Inabano kuninomiyatsuko clan, the powerful clan in Yakami no Kori, Inaba Province, and known for her tragic love with Aki no Okimi, which was contained in "Manyoshu."
She was from the Inabano kuninomiyatsuko clan, the powerful clan in Yakami no Kori, Inaba Province, and known for her tragic love with Aki no Okimi, which was contained in "Manyoshu."
She was from the Inabano kuninomiyatsuko clan, the powerful clan in Yakami no Kori, Inaba Province, and known for her tragic love with Aki no Okimi, which was contained in "Manyoshu."

sen.j: 藤原麻呂の長男・藤原浜成を産んだ稲葉国造気豆女と同一人物と言う説が有力。
sen.e: It is a likely opinion that she was identical with Inabano Kuninomiyatsuko kimame no musume, who gave birth to FUJIWARA no Hamanari, the first son of FUJIWARA no Maro.
sen.cmt: 「稲葉国造気豆女」の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: It is a likely opinion that she was identical with 稲葉国造気豆女 (Inabano Kuninomiyatsuko kimame no musume), who gave birth to FUJIWARA no Hamanari, the first son of FUJIWARA no Maro.
sen.cmt: 「稲葉国造気豆女」を追記（読みが定かでないため）
sen.e: It is a likely opinion that she was identical with 稲葉国造気豆女 (Inabano Kuninomiyatsuko kimame no musume), who gave birth to FUJIWARA no Hamanari, the first son of FUJIWARA no Maro.

sen.j: 桓武天皇の寵愛を受けた因幡国造浄成女とは同族とされる。
sen.e: It is considered that she was from the same clan of Inabano Kuninomiyatsuko Kiyonari no musume, who was loved by Emperor Kanmu.
It is considered that she was from the same clan as Inabano Kuninomiyatsuko Kiyonari no musume, who was loved by Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: the same clan of --> the same clan as
sen.e: It is considered that she was from the same clan as Inabano Kuninomiyatsuko Kiyonari no musume, who was loved by Emperor Kanmu.

sen.j: 飯高諸高
sen.e: IITAKA no Morotaka
IITAKA no Morotaka
IITAKA no Morotaka

sen.j: 伊勢国飯高郡出身。
sen.e: She was from Iitaka gun, Ise province.
She was from Iitaka gun, Ise province.
She was from Iitaka gun, Ise province.

sen.j: 長命で、元正天皇、聖武天皇、孝謙天皇、淳仁天皇、光仁天皇の計5人6代に仕える。
sen.e: She lived so long that she served for six tenures of five emperors, Emperor Gensho, Emperor Shomu, Emperor Koken, Emperor Junnin, and Emperor Konin.
She lived so long that she served for six tenures of five emperors, Emperor Gensho, Emperor Shomu, Emperor Koken, Emperor Junnin, and Emperor Konin.
She lived so long that she served for six tenures of five emperors, Emperor Gensho, Emperor Shomu, Emperor Koken, Emperor Junnin, and Emperor Konin.

sen.j: その功績により、宿禰の姓を賜る。
sen.e: She was given the title Sukune, in recognition of her services.
She was given the title Sukune, in recognition of her services.
She was given the title Sukune, in recognition of her services.

sen.j: 采女祭
sen.e: Unemematsuri
Unemematsuri
Unemematsuri

sen.j: 奈良市の猿沢池畔にある采女神社の毎年9月18日に行われる例祭。
sen.e: An annual festival observed on November 18 at Unemejinja shrine by Sarusawa no ike pond in Nara prefecture.
An annual festival observed on November 18 at Unemejinja shrine by Sarusawa no ike pond in Nara prefecture.
An annual festival observed on November 18 at Unemejinja shrine by Sarusawa no ike pond in Nara prefecture.

sen.j: 奈良時代のさる天皇の寵愛を失った采女が猿沢池に投身自殺したとされ、その霊を慰める祭り。
sen.e: It is believed that Uneme who lost love of the emperor committed suicide by jumping into the pond during the Nara period, and Unemematsuri is held for honoring the memory of the Uneme.
It is believed that Uneme who had lost emperor's favor committed suicide by jumping into the pond in the Nara period; Unemematsuri has been held to let the soul of the Uneme rest in peace.
It is believed that Uneme who had lost emperor's favor committed suicide by jumping into the pond in the Nara period; Unemematsuri has been held to let the soul of the Uneme rest in peace.

sen.j: 謡曲「采女 (能)」はこのエピソードを題材としている。
sen.e: This episode was the motif of a Noh song 'Uneme.'
This episode was the motif of the Noh song 'Uneme.'
sen.cmt: a Noh song 'Uneme.' --> the Noh song 'Uneme.'
sen.e: This episode was the motif of the Noh song 'Uneme.'
